column4: anyone: how do i add another resolution option for my monitor?
- edit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
look at this, where do i edit it, (by the way I added those 1280x1024 sections) http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/1257/
lol, got it, but how do i paste the modline there?
- get to an xterm and type sudo pico /etc/X11/xorg.conf  (you might want to cp xorg.conf to xorg.conf.backup just incase)
I did...1280x1024...wont show up
- did you set it as the first resolution in the list?
- if not you have to use a tool to switch between the resolutions.
yeah
- that generally means your monitor doesnt support a resolution that high then.  :(
- can you pastebin your current config so I can look it over?
sure, just so you know i have a 15.4 inch widescreen thats 1280x800, and the external hooked up that's 1280x1024, i dont care what it is on the widescreen
in your Section "Screen" that begins on line 136 in that pastebin URL try adding "1024x768" as the last option...
and every line after starting with 143 right?
as a last resort 1024x768 will work 99.9% of the time incase your monitor cant handle the higher res  :)
its in 1024x768
well im in XGL
so any ideas?
- running out of 'em.  :(  maybe #ubuntu-xgl?
you here?
